query:
Question: Which group consists only of living things?

Choices:
A: rabbit, seed, bird
B: seed, bird, wind
C: Volcano, candle, rabbit
D: wind, candle, volcano
steps: Identify the living things in each choice.
Choice A has a rabbit (living), a seed (can grow into a living thing), and a bird (living).
Choice B has a seed (can grow into a living thing), a bird (living), and wind (non-living).
Choice C contains a volcano (non-living), a candle (non-living), and a rabbit (living).
Choice D consists of wind (non-living), a candle (non-living), and a volcano (non-living).
Only Choice A has both living things (rabbit and bird) and a seed (which can grow into a living thing).
